intro: Anidrum didymum, commonly known as the twin-flowered anidrum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white. Anidrum didymum is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to grow in shaded areas. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying plant diversity in the Neotropics.
